DOC.brief_title: A Study Diabetic Patients With De Novo Native Coronary Artery Lesions
DOC.detailed_description: This multicenter ( 19 site ) , prospective , 2 arm randomize study design ass safety effectiveness CYPHER sirolimus-eluting stent compare uncoated Bx VELOCITY balloon-expandable stent patient manifest diabetes mellitus . Patients de novo native coronary artery lesion < = 42 mm length > =2.5mm < =3.5mm diameter ( visual estimate ) include study . A total 190 patient enter randomly allocate CYPHERTM sirolimus-eluting stent uncoated Bx VELOCITY balloon-expandable stent 1:1 ratio . Patients follow 12 month post-procedure , patient repeat angiography 8 month ( ± 1 month ) . It anticipate total duration study 18 month : 6 month complete patient enrollment 12 month follow .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis angina pectoris define Canadian Cardiovascular Society Classification ( CCS I , II , III , IV ) OR unstable angina pectoris ( Braunwald Classification B III ) OR patient document silent ischemia ; Manifest diabetes mellitus , proven fast glucose ( 12 h ) > 127 mg/dl oral glucose challenge : > = 200 mg/dl 2 h diabetes mellitus already treat oral antidiabetic insulin ; Treatment de novo native coronary artery lesion major coronary artery patient single multivessel disease ; patient 2 morevesseldisease enrol previous treatment ( ) lesion target lesion take place least 3 month prior enrolment study . If 1 study stent necessary treat lesion , overlap strongly recommend ; Target vessel diameter lesion site > = 2.5mm < = 3.5mm ( visual estimate ) ; ( stent available 2.5 / 3.0 mm width ) ; Target lesion < = 42mm length ( visual estimate ) ; ( stent available 8 , 18 33 mm length ) ; Target lesion diameter stenosis > 50 % < 100 % ( visual estimate ) ;
